caption: Really delicious pizza with a great natural wine program. I had 3 glasses, each was delicious! Service was quick and good as well, if I lived around here I would be a regular.
Pizzas and cocktails are great, spacious indoor and outdoor dining areas, easy to make a reservation.
Always dreamy pizza here.  Oh and the wines, Mamma Mia!
My favorite place in Williamsburg.
Food was good, but it took about 20 minutes for a server to even greet us. Not sure if they were understaffed, but the service was underwhelming.
I've been pleased with the items I've bought  here.  However, some of the menu items are pricey.
Very good pizza sauce..
Delicious sourdough bread
Kitchen is too slow!

Went for the sourdough pizza and fell in love with everything on the menu at Leo. Pizza Pomodoro with prosciutto added was amazing with perfect thickness, bite and crunch in the crust with sourdough flavor lingering in the mouth. Mortadella sandwich on sourdough competes with my absolute favorite sandwich, a muffelatta in New Orleans, with perfect balance of meat, creamy cheese and peppers. Olive oil cake was delish and another standout. Worth a trip no matter where you are coming from.
Very good food. The staff is extremely nice as well. The food is very very fresh! This is a must try!!

Great pizza, bread, pastry and natural wines. They had a sausage and roasted squash pizza that was perfection. Cute bakery space and super nice people. It smells amazing in there! They have some heated outdoor seating, but no table service at the moment. You order inside at the bakery or on their website.
Love the pizza but the sourdough bread is one the best in Williamsburg.

On top of being some of the most-dialed in pizza I’ve ever had, and offering really accessible natural wine, the staff there is really accommodating and sweet.  Seamless ended up leaving our order in a different building, and Sierra made sure that the matter was resolved quickly and warmly.  I’m also realizing that when my old work’s holiday party was there last year,  Leo had just opened. So good to see the place going strong and putting out good everything.

Leo is our favorite spot for coffee & baked goods in our neighborhood. They make the best Latte in the area that I’m aware of. Their pizza is as good or better than any around which is saying something.
Amazing and safe service. The food was incredible.
Great wine great pizza - chef’s kiss
My favorite neighborhood pizza/bakery in Williamsburg. Every time I want a great slice- I head straight to Leo. Quality food, people are lovely, great wine selection.
Best bagel I’ve ever had in my life. The sourdough bagel with cream cheese is everything.
Definitely one of the best pizza around. Nothing van compete with the sourdough
Literally the perfect restaurant.
Great pizza & great service!!

I would travel days for a slice of Leo’s pizza. The sourdough bread is perfection, the wine and beer selection to go are well assorted and good array of prices. Feels like a cozy neighborhood spot even if you’re just picking up a slice or a to-go Negroni, which are strong and tasty!

Long live Leo! This place is shockingly good. The service was amazing and every single thing we ate and drank here was wonderful. Perfect bread, butter, pizza, organic wine, and soft serve. I will be back.
Natural wine pizza time. Great spot.

Best pizza in the neighborhood! When ingredients are just natural and super fresh and they are perfectly cooked, the pizza just feels fantastic! Natural wines to perfectly pair your food and don’t miss the frozen Negroni (amazing!). Enjoy!

Really odd experience just now. Pizza is great but service was incredibly off tonight. I walked in to order a couple of slices which was fairly normal, however the pizzas were left unattended and ultimately were burnt. The waitress then let me know she'd burned one slice but still tried to serve me the other burned slice. Additionally, she put the slice into a paper slip right out of the oven which then I requested a small box for as the pizza would melt onto the paper. I politely declined but was met with an awful attitude as if I was the one inconveniencing her. She quickly threw the new slices into the oven, placed them into the paper sleeves after two minutes, and I'm now picking my pizza off of the paper sleeve.  Definitely not the service I expected and hope to have a better experience if I come back.
take out on a friday night ... one chicken. one margherita. one arugula mushroom. obviously that one was devoured as no photo evidence exists ...
Leo has such a great pizza! Truly one of the best in Williamsburg, especially the mushroom pizza. And I really enjoy the chopped salad.

Worst place to eat pizza! Waiting time to get our pie was 42 min when usually some other places released same pie btw 12-18 min, super bad service and its super clear since most of the delivery courier were talking that they have waited more than 40 min. I was expecting to see the manager apologized but no presence whatsoever. At the end of the day no worth the line to get table and service. Hard to support local restaurant like this one!
Amazing pizza and even better service

love this place. I’m actually writing a review about their sourdough bagels... so good! I get the lox on everything bagel and it’s sooooo good. Don’t take it off the menu! my only complaint is my bf and roommate ordered once their guanciale egg cheese but got it on the bagel instead of brioche bun and when we went back the following weekend the person said “it couldn’t be done.” ... little disappointing.

Love everything from the sourdough everything bagels to the sourdough loaves...meatballs are bomb and their wine selection is 🔥. And the soft serve ? Drooling. Pies are spot on with flavor too-my fav one is the one with sausage/red onion/olives (sorry I can’t remember he name !) My goodness. Great service too! Thankful they are in the area.
Great spot for amazing sourdough pizza and tasty wines. Also, the best calzone ever!
Awesome food, great wines too! Incredible dough to the pizza and top ingredients. One of my absolute favorite places
Fantastic margherita pizza made with delicious homemade sourdough.
Had the mushroom pizza delivered, solid 9, not a 10 bc some areas burnt. crust and toppings are superb delicious, great to have Leo in the neighborhood when you want a pie a step above best pizza.
Great atmosphere, was a little worried about the number system but that worked perfect. Rad spot. Love the wine fridge and somm was helpful.
Pretty good pies
So good! We ordered a bunch of slices and everything was amazing. My favorite was the mushroom slice. The service was great! Would highly recommend!
Pizza with house made chili oil...check. Cocktails that make your knees feel like jelly...check. Tiramisu that tastes like creamy goodness...check. Leo and Ops have my respeck 🙌🏻

Pizza is great and I’d rate it higher were it not for the service / price ratio. Having to put in the entire food order at the bar before putting your name down for a table and then hovering with your order in the bar area on a busy night number kills the vibe and isn’t appropriate for the price point I’ll probably opt for their slice shop going forward.

Was my first time  I went to this pizza place   Number one. the service is terrible. I was seating at the table for 10 min   Before the waitress  appear. Second.. it was I  have to get up from the table and go order at the bar my drinks and pizza  good luck to this place
Divine pizza. Awesome Manhattan cocktail
Very welcoming and great addition to the neighborhood. Pizza was delicious and wine (on tap!) was great too. I'll be back for sure

Fabulous new place with outstanding creative pizza. We had the clam pie and the "hill" veggie pie and they were scrumptious, with incredible crust. Also the side of bitter greens is unusual and great. Order the bread, it is great and come with butter from Normandy that is heaven. The wine list is so creative and ambience is friendly and warm. Finally, the caramel and grapefruit soft serve is so weird and totally wonderful!
Top!!!

I waited for my pizzas for over an hour. The responses I got from the waitresses were dismissive, clueless, and unhelpful. Food is good, but you don’t return to a restaurant for the food, but rather: the service.
This place has it all. Great atmosphere, amazing pizza, fantastic salad and natural wine. The head chef is incredible.

Came in here at 8pm on a Saturday night, they warned us there weren’t many tables available so we ordered a pizza and a salad to go. Were quoted 20min wait... we were finally given our pizza at 9pm and they forgot our salad. Had to wait another half an hour and finally walked out at 9:30 with our takeout order. Pizza is cold now. We could have gone to another restaurant, had a meal, and been home in the time it took them to prepare our to go order. It was suggested that we order drinks while we wait but an $8 beer comes in a short glass, not even a pint. Every wine is $14 by the glass regardless of the bottle price. This place is over-hyped and offers poor service for the price. You should switch to table service or figure out how to serve your customers in a reasonable timeframe. Because we had to pay up front, we weren’t able to get any discount or withhold tip for the service provided. First time coming to Leo and never coming back.
The crust of the mushroom crostini was reminiscent of a Montreal style bagel. It's great to have a pizzeria open for breakfast.

the new pizza spot from Ops pizza is quirky in all the right ways. Very good pizza and sides you order from a counter. Amazing wine and beer program you grab as you want from the wall or fridge. The traditional pizzas are fantastic and add available toppings as you want!
Great selection of little bites and gourmet pizza. Outstanding sourdough and fresh crusts.

I came to try the pizza, but ended up trying the bread & butter as well, and I am so glad I did: the sourdough bread was delicious. A simple dish, yet so satisfying :)  The pizza was also good (I tried the Margherita) but I didn’t think it was outstanding (would get Best Pizza’s grandma slice over this one) but I’d go back for the bread and butter and to try their sandwiches which looked great.

The slice shop/ lunch counter side of Leos is an unassuming storefront along Havermeyer. The daily options for paninis and Square cut slices are laid out behind glass while salads and whole pies are made to order.  My slices had a wonderful crisp crunch along with just enough chew to feel substantial.  The potato pie was a little underwhelming at the time compared to its more traditional cousins (margarita and meatball, respectively) but 2 days later it's definitely the slice that is standing out to me. The carby, creamy, starchy potatoes married with the tangy sourdough crust to form a truly lovely bite.  The mortadella panini is another truly standout option.  Incredible quality and respect for proportions propel this sandwich to a whole greater than the sum of its parts. Paired with the colored salad,  it makes for a refined but hearty meal.  Nice but small beer selection,  adequate seating.  As for the more formal Grand St. Side,  I'll reserve a review of that for when I return to have the Clam Pie 😁
Great Neapolitan style pizza in an elevated setting with solid service that deserves repeat visits. Don't forget to check out the specials, you might miss out on something unique!
Delicious pizza, light and airy crust. Anchovies croquettes are incredible.

Had breakfast at their bakery.  Great coffee, good sandwiches and pastry pizza thing.  Would have loved a more diverse breakfast menu, or some more of their breads to be available.  I’d def come here again, even if just for a ham and mustard sandwich and an espresso.
Chopped salad, lasagna, bean dish, pizza...everything we’ve had is amazing. Great service and love their natural wine selection.
The bread program is insane. So consistently good, I love it. Love it.
Amazing!!
All good!!!!!!!!!

Leo is a very welcome addition to an area that is surprisingly lacking in good options for coffee and baked goods.  I stopped to pick up breakfast and tried their PHENOMENAL cheese and butter sandwich.  I also had an excellent espresso drink, an oat milk latte.  All the other breakfast options looked delicious, and I look forward to a return visit to try them.  Bearing the venerable Bushwick pizza joint Ops' background, the lunch and dinner options are certain to be just as compelling.
Amazing spot for lunch! The pizza is masterful and the coffee is very impressive. Grab a fresh baked bread loaf on your way out.
